intro: Lucuma urbanii, commonly known as the golden apple, is a species of tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its large, yellow-orange fruit that resembles a small apple. The fruit is typically harvested when it is fully mature and has a sweet, nutty flavor. The plant thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. It is valued not only for its edible fruit but also for its ornamental qualities and traditional uses in local cultures.
